newsitem.title: CANADA: Bombardier, de Havilland workers reach labor pact.
newsitem.headline: Bombardier, de Havilland workers reach labor pact.

text.p: A tentative labour contract has been reached between Bombardier Inc.'s de Havilland unit and its unionized workers, narrowly averting a strike, the union said on Monday.

The new three-year deal was reached just minutes before the 10 a.m. EDT(/1400 GMT) strike deadline set by the Canadian Auto Workers union, which represents 3,800 of the 6,326 workers at Toronto-based de Havilland aircraft maker.
The tentative agreement is set to be ratified by union members on Saturday.

The plant, which was acquired from Boeing Co. in 1994 by Montreal-based Bombardier, makes the de Havilland Dash-8 turboprop regional aircraft and assembles the new Bombardier Global Express long-range business jet.
